title: Google's Compact Language Detector 3
text: R Wrapper Google’s Compact Language Detector 3  Google’s Compact Language Detector 3 neural network model language identification successor CLD2 (available ) CRAN. version still experimental uses novell algorithm different properties outcomes. information see: https://github.com/google/cld3#readme

title: Google's Compact Language Detector 3
text: function detect_language() vectorised guesses language string text returns NA language reliably determined. function detect_language_multi() vectorised detects languages inside entire character vector whole.
code: > library(cld3) > example(cld3)  cld3> # Vectorized best guess cld3> detect_language(c("To be or not to be?", "Ce n'est pas grave.", "猿も木から落ちる")) [1] "en" "fr" "ja" cld3> # Multiple languages in one text cld3> detect_language_mixed("This piece of text is in English. Този текст е на Български.", size = 3)   language probability reliable proportion 1       bg   0.9173891     TRUE  0.5853658 2       en   0.9999790     TRUE  0.4146341 3      und   0.0000000    FALSE  0.0000000

title: Google's Compact Language Detector 3
text: Binary packages OS-X Windows can installed directly CRAN: Installation source Linux OSX requires Google’s Protocol Buffers library. Debian Ubuntu install libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler: Fedora need protobuf-devel: CentOS / RHEL install [protobuf-devel](https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/protobuf via EPEL: OS-X use protobuf Homebrew:
code: install.packages("cld3") sudo apt-get install -y libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler sudo yum install protobuf-devel sudo yum install epel-release sudo yum install protobuf-devel brew install protobuf
